title: AI Threat Demands New Approach to Security Designs

content.background: The potential threat posed by the rapid development of artificial intelligence (AI) means safeguards need to be built into systems from the start rather than tacked on later. This is due to the high power and fast-moving nature of AI.
content.summary: US official, Jen Easterly, emphasizes the need for security measures to be incorporated into AI systems at the design stage. Agencies from 18 countries have endorsed British-developed guidelines on AI cybersecurity. Security throughout the AI life cycle is crucial, according to Sami Khoury, head of Canada's Centre for Cyber Security. In an effort to manage risks, leading AI developers have agreed to collaborate with governments for pre-release testing.

content.background: Zscaler Inc., a cybersecurity company, reported better-than-expected results for the latest quarter but chose not to increase its full-year billings forecast. The calculated billings for the fiscal first quarter were $457 million, up from $340 million the previous year.
content.summary: Zscaler Inc. exceeded expectations in the latest quarter but did not change its full-year billings forecast. Despite the positive results, the company's stock declined. The calculated billings for the fiscal first quarter were $457 million.
